definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: A disreputable or run-down bar or nightclub.
sentences.chinese: 一種比較下賤的名聲不好的夜總會或舞廳。

sentences.english: In our country there are many people think do the physical work is contemptible .
sentences.chinese: 在我們的國家還有不少人認爲幹體力活是下賤的。

sentences.english: You are a typical cheap paki lier.
sentences.chinese: 你是一個典型的巴基斯坦下賤撒謊者。

sentences.english: The Prince of Darkness does not condescend to such cheap drudgery.
sentences.chinese: 這種下賤的差使，根本用不着勞“黑暗之王”的大駕。

sentences.english: It's a snotty takedown of a straw man.
sentences.chinese: 這完全是是一個無足輕重的人的下賤的貶低。

sentences.english: The question, of course, is what motivates this awful behavior?
sentences.chinese: 當然，問題在於，是什麼使他們做出這麼下賤的行爲？

sentences.english: They are a low, evil people.
Rise, and don't degrade yourself into an abject reptile .
sentences.chinese: 起來，可別把你自己貶成一個下賤的爬蟲。

sentences.english: You can be cheap, you can be lucky, but you can't be both.
sentences.chinese: 你可以下賤，可以很幸運，但是決不能兩者兼得。

sentences.english: Rise, and don't degrade youself into an abject reptile.
sentences.chinese: 起來，可別把你自己貶成一個下賤的爬蟲。

sentences.english: We all need love and being loved, no matter in what way.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟敢愛敢恨自力更生，也沒有理由鄙夷人家的下賤。

definition: to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
